intro: Cleome microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf spider flower, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Cleomaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Cleome microcarpa thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or as a bedding plant.
